1.content:
You call for help as loud as you can... But still nobody comes.
You just decide to wait. A few hours pass... Still nobody came.
Suddenly, a movement comes from the trees. You go to investigate and it is...
1.title: Movement.

choices: Taylor gets up and begins to walk on
The story goes to his family at camp
11.content:
Taylor looks up in the trees to see nothing but a bird. He kept hopping some one would come to find him but when no one did he knew he was on his own. Even though he didn't know where to go he got up knowing that he couldn't just sit there all night. He looked around trying to see some way back home but when it failed he just headed in a random direction.
Taylor thought about he got into this situation. He had told his dad that he didn't want to go but his father told him to do so, and as a 9 year old child he did as he was told. He walked off into the forest angry at his father for making him go into the mysterious woods. Now all that he felt was fear for the unknown.
He didn't know how far he walked nor for how long, but his legs were beginning to ache and eyes were beginning to grow heavy. Taylor found a small stone able to seat him and a sat on it. He took his shoes off to empty them of dirt and pebbles that might of ventured his way in them. A pile was formed after he had finished.
When he was done emptying his shoes he continued to sit in the dark scary forest. Owls cried in the night and a full moon gave broken light to the forest. The forest seemed empty but he instinct told him otherwise. When he thought he heard a faint voice he screamed and yelled as loud as he could. When their was no response he buried his head in his hands and began to cry.
"I want to go home." He cried to himself over and over again. Tears ran down his rosy red cheeks. He had never felt more helpless in his life. He was alone and scared. Taylor had often had to fend for himself at school but this time it was different.
As the night grew darker Taylor continued to sit there not knowing what he would do now. His eyes grew even more heavy and even closed but Taylor forced them open only to close again...
11.title: Walking through the woods.

111.content:
It didn't take long to fall asleep. He had been walking all day and exhausted from his travel and worry. When he did fall asleep it was much needed. When asleep he forgot all problems. The world of dreams calmed him and allowed him to escape away from his troubles. When asleep he was with his family, he didn't go get firewood, he had never even left the saftey of his home; being asleep thought was only a small get way from what he would have to eventually go back to when he woke up.
Taylor woke up cold and wet. It had gently rained while he was asleep. He sat up and cleaned his arms of dirt and leaves. Grogginess had caused confusion he forgot where he was and what had happened. Then when became more aware of his surroundings he recalled all that had taken place since the night before. He sat there until he was fully awake and able to make clear decisions. His first one was to cry. He didn't stop till his stomach growled.
Taylor was faced wiith another problem. The fire wood was going to be used to cook with; he hadn't eaten last night. Thirst played a factor to as well. The miserable boy stood up slowly and carried on with small hope of finding his way back to his camp site.
The 9 year old boy walked onward and onward ingnoring his aching body and his empty stomach. He tried to think about what way he came from and which way he should go, but was unable to concentrate. Several times he stoped beside a tree to cry. "I want to go home." was all he said. It was all he wanted. Each time he would stop he walk another 100 ft before stopping to do so again. Each time would be longer than the other. It wouldn't be till the 12th time his crying would be inturupted by a second partty.
111.title: Taylor  falls asleep

1111.content: Taylor (The 9 year old boy) Looks around the woods, and sees a dark shadow, what is thought of to be a mirage, lurk closer to him. Taylor could hear the rustling... And the snapping... And the crunching from whatever is coming... Taylor shivers as a leaf falls onto his scared face. He throws it off and makes a runner. Taylor looks back, watching the figure turn smaller, but bigger. Suddenly, Taylor trips over a log, and falls on his knee. Before starting to cry, he says: "Ouch!!!" and then, begins to cry. But, how did the log get there? Taylor wonders. He gets up, and brushes the dirt off himself. And starts to run again. By now, the dark figure is HUGE, but tiny aswell, what could it be... Taylor gets even more scared. The dark shadow is right behind him. Taylor turns quickly and jumps at what he sees... It is...
1111.title: Taylor gets scared and run

11112.content:
a Toucan that scared Taylor.
"You’re a silly one." The Toucan said as it landed only a few feet away from Taylor. Taylor was shocked at what a toucan would be doing in the forest. Then it scared him that it talked. He sat there with his mouth hung open and hands behind him. He dared not to speak and if he did he didn't know what he would say. "Can you only scream?" The toucan said to Taylor. He jumped and flapped his wings as he spoke letting loose of red, orange feathers that were beautiful to all. Taylor didn't answer he only flinched. The toucan only looked at Taylor with his large shiny eyes. It tilted its head and danced around Taylor as it spoke. "Can you hear me?" The toucan said again as it jumped on Taylor's legs.
" What?" Taylor asked. He stuttered and it was mistaking for the end of the sentence.
The toucan moved up Taylor's body to reach his ears. "I said are can you hear me!" The toucan yelled into Taylor's ear.
"Get off!" Taylor yelled back. He moved his arms which sent the bird flying off. He landed not too far from Taylor again. "What are you?" Taylor asked with a broken voice. Never had he thought he would ever speak to a toucan. The colorful bird danced around the small scared boy. It didn’t stop it continued to dance around the boy even when it spoke.
“What do I look like?” The toucan said.
“A bird” Taylor responded. The bird finally stopped in front of Taylor to stick its tongue out in a mocking manor. The animated nature of the toucan had brought down Taylor’s fear and turned it into confusion. “But you talk.”
“Well I guess that makes me a toucan that can talk.” The toucan said to Taylor as it did a back flip. Taylor sat there not knowing what to do next. Silence had taken place between the two. The only actions were that of the toucan whose eyes blinked constantly. It wasn’t till the growl of Taylor’s stomach let a loud growl and roared. They both stood there waiting for the other to make a comment; no comment would be made until the toucan said something that someone would address Taylor’s hunger, but the mood would not change.
With no emotion and movement the toucan said “Are you hungry?” Taylor’s response would start his adventure.
11112.title: A toucan, in the forest?

choices: Taylor does not go with him
111121.content:
Taylor nodded yes seeing no reason why to lie to the so far harmless toucan. Taylor sat there as the toucan flew into a green tree where he landed on a branch that could be seen from Taylor’s view. It made loud calling sound to Taylor before speaking out.
“Well then come on,” The toucan began “I know a place where you can eat.” Taylor continued to sit there as the toucan made a loud calling sound again. He didn’t move. Taylor was lost in thought; He had no idea where he was and how he got there. Know a stranger was telling him to follow him. He had learned that he should never talk to strangers from school, TV. shows, and his parents, but they never prepared him to talk to a strange toucan. He continued to sit there not knowing what to do next. “Well are you coming? If you’re hungry you have to eat.”
“I don’t know.” Taylor said. He was hungry but hunger couldn’t get rid of his cautious nature. The toucan turned in circle on the tree as Taylor thought. He didn’t know what to do. He was tired and hungry and would really enjoy something to eat, but he was talking to a toucan that had shouldn’t be talking in the first place. “If I go home I could eat. Could you take me there instead?”
“Where do you live?” The toucan asked. The toucan was in no way a harmful creature. It only wanted to help the small boy who needed it.
“I live in Pinkerton but I’m on a camping trip with my family.” Taylor explained to the bird who flew from tree to tree.
“What’s Pinkerton, what’s a family, and what’s camping.” The toucan asked Taylor. These words were not known to the bird who had spent his life flying his world since he was a baby. To Taylor this meant another obstacle that had to be overcome; hopefully by thou rough explanation Taylor hoped to somehow find his way home.
“You know Pinkerton, its my home in the mountains, and camping is when you sleep outside in a tent, and a family…” Taylor said to the toucan that had landed on the ground in the middle of Taylor’s explanation. Taylor was standing and looking to the down to the ground. The toucan stood waiting for Taylor to continue his murky explanation. He had not never ever stood so still nor had he ever been so confused. Taylor stood there thinking of how he would explain a family based on experiences. “A family is the people you live with. They hardly are home, and always make you do things even when you’re scared and you tell them. You do it anyway because… because they tell you to, and you want them to love you.” Taylor explained. It was silent yet again and again it would be interrupted by the lively toucan.
“I have no idea what you are talking about.” The toucan said. Taylor let out a sigh and sat by a tree to cry. He thought that he was going to be able to go home. He had often wished that he could get away from home; now he wished that he could go back. He couldn’t stop crying. He was upset, angry, scared, and frustrated. He was upset because of the situation he was in, scared because he was alone in a forest, frustrated because he was unable to communicate with the toucan, and angry because he felt his family was to blame. The toucan may not know much, but emotions were one of the few things he did know.
“Why are you crying little one?” The toucan said as he jumped to Taylor’s legs. Taylor’s sobs almost muted the toucan’s words. It tried to touch Taylor with his wing but Taylor threw his hands down to respond.
“I want to go home. That’s it… I’m tired, hungry, and dirty. I want to go home but you can’t take me!” Taylor cried. The toucan felt somewhat responsible for Taylor’s current condition. Taylor was to emotional to find one reason why he was crying and months of bottled up emotions had burst out. The toucan was determined though to find a way to help the small boy. He had helped other’s before and never failed.
“Come with me I know someone who can help.” The toucan said. Taylor stopped his cries to listen. The toucan made eye contact to show how series he was. “Come on little one I know some one who can help you.”
111121.title: Taylor says yes

11113.content: Taylor turns quickly and jumps at what he sees... It is...
11113.title: Any of these??

choices: Get the object Shadow dropped in the bush
Try and revive him before he dies
Steal his shoes to see if you can run super fast
Find out what it was that tried to kill him
12.content:
You take a few steps closer towards the source of the noise, small twigs snapping beneath your feet. You hear a deep rumbling, a desperate yell for help, and a faint rustling that was steadily gaining momentum. Even though you feel a bit intimidated by the noise, you press onwards in the hopes of getting out of the forest.

Suddenly, a black blur runs right next to you, spinning you around and knocking you down on your feet! Ignoring the pounding noise rising up in your head, you quickly force yourself up to see what it was.

It's Shadow the Hedgehog! You feel so shocked, its like your whole body is being electrocuted. He stops a short distance away, leaning over slightly as he holds something against a bloody bruise on his chest. He force yourself up as quick as you can, tripping over yourself slightly, and walk closer to him to investigate.

Once you get a bit closer, you notice Shadow is looking down with his eyes clenched shut and breathing deeply due to his wound. Blood was slowly wicking around his hand, staining it a deep dark red.

Now you just feel more surprised than anything. How does Shadow the Hedgehog get injured like this? You see his legs tremble, and he soon falls straight to the ground. The hand covering his wound flops to the ground, and an object he had been holding in his hand falls into a nearby bush. His breathing is slowly decreasing, and his muscles releasing their tension as they slowly faded away.

Panicking, you have no idea what you should do. You do the first thing that comes to your mind, and...
12.title: Shadow the Hedgehog

122.content: You do the first thing that comes to your mind, and you try and revive him, as quick as you can, before he dies. You reach deep down in your pocket and find a small bottle, around the size of two of the average human's middle fingers. You unscrew the lid as fast as you can, and gently open Shadow's jaw. You tip the bottle in his mouth as he gulps it down. Suddenly, he grunts... And stands up, only to fall again. You rush beneath him before he drops and grab him. You lay him down, his head propped against a small log that you tripped over before, and look at the wound on his chest. You get some water on your two fingers and tap it on the wound a couple of times. The blood stops, but some is still on your fingers from touching it. You look out into the bushes and see something shimmer. You squint, and stare at it. Suddenly, Shadow mumbles "Thank-you... Stranger..." And you turn. You smile and carefully pick him up from under his armpits. He trembles, but is OK. He asks you politely to fetch the object that Shadow dropped earlier. And you...
122.title: He is okay.

choices: You shake your head and stay put.
1221.content: He asks you politely to fetch the object that Shadow dropped earlier. And you agree, so off you went, walking into a bush... Simply bending down, grabbing the item, and walking back to Shadow the Hedgehog. In your mind, you are scared, you've played the game, but didn't know that he was REAL! Anyway, you cleared that out of your thoughts. You walk back to the log, asking if he is OK, he replies "Yes." Then you give him the item. He tries to push himself up, and falls, again. You prop him against the log again and stare at him, his big red eyes slowly disappear as his thick, black eyelids block them. You sigh. And you quietly say "I'm never going to get back, now... I must be AGES away from that small tent..." And Shadow opens his eyes and looks at you, he questions: "Are you OK?" And you nod. But really, you aren't. Shadow says that his legs are better now, and he thinks he can manage to walk. So you help him up. And he asks you to follow him. If you come with him, that's WHEN your adventure starts. If you don't go with him... See the results for yourself, if you wish.
1221.title: Are you coming?

12211.content: You don't say anything for a while, you want to collect your thoughts. You look at him injured, and in pain. Could you possibly leave him alone like that? "I... I don't think that's the best idea, but I'll go." Shadow let out a casual smile which surprises you. "You need a hand?" "No, don't worry about me..." Then he takes few steps and falls again. You run to him "Come on, I can help you." he then looks at you and replies "Alright, I guess I can use a little help" he says, you can tell that he's kind of angry at himself. After few steps both of you synchronized and walking became easier. "So are you going to tell me what's going on here?" "Sorry I can't tell you much..." you sigh "So at least tell me what is that thing you wanted me to pick up" "It's a chaos emerald... Perhaps you heard something about it?" Now it hit you, Chaos Emeralds were in Sonic The Hedgehog game series. However You didn't remembered a lot. "More or less..." then you noticed that Shadow is getting kind of heavier, you realized that he's getting weaker and tired and can't hold up himself. "Are you OK?" "Yes... I'm just... tired a little bit." "You want to stop here for night or maybe keep going?" Shadow decides to...
12211.title: You obidiently follow.

122112.content: Shadow decides to keep going. He grunts and tries to stand up again. You let out a long sigh."Hop on my back," you say calmly to Shadow. "I'll carry you. You can't possibly expect to walk YET..." Shadow smirks and stands on a small rock. You bend down, and there is an aching pain for a few seconds as Shadow jumps on your back. You kneel down a little and stand up. Suddenly, you come to a fork in the forest. There are two clear pathways, one of them is beautiful and flowery, the other - dark and dreary. You jump as a drop of water - or something - trickles onto your shoulder. "Aack!" you yelp, as you turn your head to the right. You notice that Shadow has fell asleep and has been drooling all over your shoulder. You feel sick, but suck it up and turn back to the two pathways. What one should you go down?
122112.title: Why So Soon?

1221122.content: 'What one should you go down?' you think to yourself, and you think that the dark path would be safer, as the bright one may be a trap. You breathe in and walk down the path. .......You've been walking for a few hours now, and you're legs are getting tired. You find a small 'base' in the forest and decide to use that for the night. After laying Shadow down, covering him with your jacket, you find some leaves and make yourself a bed, not too far away, not too close to the Hedgehog. He might need you, you might need him. Settling down into bed, finally falling asleep, you hear a faint whisper. "Psst... Psst!"...You open your eyes quickly to see a dark figure with red eyes staring down at you. "AAH!" you scream, deafening the creature. "Shush!" the figure shouts. "It's me! Shadow" After hearing those words, you are relieved to hear it's a familiar voice. "Can you dig a hole for me?" Shadow asks, and you look slightly confused. "A hole? What do you need one of them for?" you reply to Shadow. "Well, I need to..."
1221122.title: It's dark out here...

choices: The damp soil in the hole.
12211221.content:
"Well, I need to use the toilet..." Shadow says to you. "Um, why can't you dig one yourself?" you ask him. "My fingers have gone numb, I can't feel them. I can't walk yet, either." Shadow replies. With a sigh, you say "Uh, okay then. But make it quick, I'm tired." After a few minutes, you finish digging. Shadow thanks you and goes to the toilet.
You turn your head before you see anything you didn't want to, and make your way back to the bed. You feel light dancing on your eyelids. It's morning. You wake up, rubbing your eyes as you straighten your back, and hear it clicking as you do so. You look around and see Shadow is gone. The only trace of him is the damp soil in the hole you dug, and a sock which looks like it had been taken off just a few minutes ago. What should you inspect?
12211221.title: Use the toilet.

choices: The damp soil in the hole.
122112212.content: You decide to inspect the sock, as it would be the less messy clue. Picking it up, you hear a small jingle inside it. You reach inside the sock, feeling the sweat which is still lingering. The smell just begins to reach your nose as you pull the jingling object out of it. You walk back to your small bed you made, and stare at the two items for a few moments. You put the sock on your left leg and look carefully at the item which was jingling. It feels cold, but warm too. "Hmm... Could this be Shadow's? And the sock too?" you think to yourself. The smell begins running up your neck and back to your nose. "Fhuwee, that Shadow needs to take a bath!" you whisper quietly, and chuckle. You turn the object in your hands and see there is an inscription etched into the silver. You hold it closer to your eye and the smell from the object which was in the sock also reaches your nose and you begin to heave. ' This Item Is The Property Of.....---- ' the rest of the words are scratched off and damaged. You pick up the sock from your leg and put it in your pocket, along with the jingling item. You need another clue. You have to look in...
122112212.title: The sock.

1221122121.content: You need another clue. You have to look in the damp soil in the hole you dug the previous night. You kneel down and look at it, the soil is indeed damp from where there had been urine. You suddenly get an idea, you pull out the jingling item and place it in the small yellow puddle which resided in the hole. You lift the item out of it and wipe it on your clothes. You take another look at the item and now see it says ' This Item Is The Property Of...
1221122121.title: The damp soil in the hole.

choices: The camp where you first met Shadow.
12211221211.content: ' This Item Is The Property Of Shadow The Hedgehog ' astonished at seeing this, you jump up and grab the sock, running down the path at full speed. After running for which seemed like days, you trip over a familiar log. Pulling yourself up from the dusty ground, you brush off the remaining dust from your clothes and notice a shadowy figure running through the forest. "Shadow!" you yell loudly, and the dark figure stops and walks to you. You begin to tremble. The dark figure is out from the shadows and it is indeed, Shadow The Hedgehog. Shadow walks towards you, and you see a very large cut on his bare ankle. You pull out the sock from your pocket, kneel down and wipe away the blood from his ankle, then putting his sock on his foot. "Are you okay? What happened to you?" you ask him. "Last night, there was a..." Shadow stops speaking. "A what? Shadow, a what?!" "A... A..." but then Shadow collapses. You pick up Shadow from his armpits and sling him over your shoulder. You decide to go back to...
12211221211.title: Shadow The Hedgehog.

choices: Nothing of interest happens in the night.
122112212111.content: You decide to go back to the dark camp you were at last night. You finally reach the site, but it looks as though Shadow's shoe may have fallen off while you were walking. "Oh well," you say, tucking Shadow into his ivy bed. You climb into your bed and start to sleep. What happens next?
122112212111.title: Really?

1221122121111.content: You finally managed to get enough sleep that night. You notice that Shadow is awake too, so you quickly get up and go to him. "Hey, are you alright?" you say nicely. Shadow doesn't even look at you but he responses "Yeah... Yeah... I'm fine." You kneel to inspect his ankle "Here, let me help you." you then rip part of your shirt and make bandage from it. "Will you tell me what happened?" Shadow just lies there motionless in silence "Ok, if you don't want to tell, don't tell." You then realized that object that you found in Shadow's sock is still in your pocket. Should you give it back to Shadow or maybe keep it for now?
1221122121111.title: Nothing of interest happens in the night.

12211221211111.content: "Oh, by the way I think it's yours" you say as you pull silver object out of your pocket.At first Shadow don't gives attention to you but when he notices this strange item he quickly grabs it. "Where did you found it?!" to your surprise he's aggressive and angry "Calm down... I found it in your sock, you remember? The one you've left here..." he then hides it somewhere, you can't actually see where, he seems to be mad at this thing. "Thanks" he then says emotionless. "You're hungry?" You say to change subject of conversation. "A little bit..." you then give him half of sandwich that you've just found in your pocket. It's a little bit creased but both of you are hungry and this is the only food you have. You think it's a high time to go but you may also try to find out what happened that mysterious night...
12211221211111.title: Give it back to Shadow

12212.content:
So you help him up. And he asks you to follow him. But, you shake your head, fold your arms and stand there. Just staring at him. Then, Shadow turns around. And with all of his strength, uses... "CHAOS... CONTROL!!" And it blasts you far off. *Blackout* .........................."Are you okay?".................... You fall back to sleep again. ........."Hello? Excuse me?"................You open your eyes... And you see a small girl, about 8 standing over you. "Who... Who are yo-" But she politely replies: "I'm Maria. Have you seen Shadow anywhere?" You look and feel shocked. You vaguely remember Shadow the Hedgehog talking about a girl, who was named Maria. He said that she died. Ages ago. But, you tell a lie and respond: "No, sorry... Maria. I haven't."........................"Oh... Well, that's ok. Hey, what's your name?" she asks you calmly. Do you remember your name? No... The blackout must of wiped some of your memory. "Are you OK?" Maria asks. You begin to lose more of your memory. "No... I don't.. Who am I? Who are you? Where am I?" The girl stares at you. "I must go... Quickly." Maria says in a hurry. And just before you can grasp her, she runs off into the forest. Later, you hear a scream... A rustle... And crows and other birds fly off. Just then, you doze off. Suddenly, a black 'shadow' runs towards you, killing you with its speed. You're dead.


Try again? This time, try following Shadow. You may find something.
12212.title: Uh-oh...

123.content:
You decide to steal his shoes, you've always wanted to run super fast! You pause for a moment... And then you purposely make your eyes lock on to something, and you point at it, screaming, "LOOK! OVER THERE!" and as you would have known, he turned and looked for it. Before his face went back on to you, you ripped his shoes straight off his feet and throw your old ones into the bush. You hear a smashing noise. Shadow shouts, "NOOOOOOOOOO!" You've smashed his item. You finish putting the final boot on your foot. You brace yourself, and begin to run. You're the same speed as you were before. They don't work!! Shadow grunts. You look petrified. 0_0 ... Shadow jumps up... And the last words you hear... Are: "CHAOS... BLAST!" Before you die.

That was the wrong choice. Go to HELL!
123.title: The wrong choice.

1231.content: You wake up. Everything is dark red. You're in HELL. Goodbye. "Muahahahahahaha..." and then, a giant foot crushes you. Too bad. You're permanently dead. Ha! Dead-Face!
1231.title: The end of the line.

13.content:
You look above in horror as at the gargantuan creature before you. A giant ape like creature stomps through the forest, pushing and knocking over trees as it stomps along, as if it were looking through the sale rack at JC Penny's. You approach the creature with caution, being very careful not to startle.Unfortunately, You're a little too quiet. The giant doesn't see you, and steps on you as it continues through the forest. Search parties comb the forest for weeks, unable to find your body because it is stuck to the creatures foot like a piece of discarded chewing gum.

THE END
13.title: A 'Giant' Mistake

choices: Stay there, someone might come for help
14.content:
"Oh, it's just the wind." somebody says from behind you.
You turn around quickly. Nothing is there.
"You can't see me, can you?" comes from behind you again.
You shriek. "W-w-wh-who are you?!" You say in terror.
"Find out for yourself. Just follow the leaves." the voice stops after. You decide to:
14.title: What is it?

143.content:
You turn around again and walk the other way. You think that the person or thing that was making you follow him was trying to set up a trap...
"He can't fool me..." you say with 2% confidence.
Just then... Something comes up from behind you... But before you can turn around to see what it is, you feel something in your stomach.
You look down... there is a samurai sword going through you... As you slowly fall to the ground, struggling to live, the thing reveals itself. But when it says its name, you die.

Choose a different chapter? Try following him next time... you might find out who he is.
143.title: End of the line.

info.brief_description: You are lost... in the forest.
info.description: You and your family decide to go for a camping trip in a forest which is 600 miles away from your home. You need to collect some wood for the fire and you go alone. Then... You collect the wood and realise you are lost!
